For the record, this is the first time you talked about a "boot CD". WHICH is the "I have downloaded and installed ***a*** program to do sector-by-sector backup of my hard drive, and i have made the backup and everything works 100%." actual program? If a sector-by-sector image fits on CD, it must be either: * NOT a sector-by-sector image * NOT a CD * a very small partition
There are two available freeware solutions for recovery partitions: Terabyte Unlimited MBR: [http://www.terabyteu...d.com/index.htm](http://www.terabyteunlimited.com/index.htm "External link") [http://www.terabyteu...ee-software.htm](http://www.terabyteunlimited.com/downloads-free-software.htm "External link") [http://www.terabyteu...wnloads/mbr.zip](http://www.terabyteunlimited.com/downloads/mbr.zip "External link") mbldr: [http://mbldr.sourceforge.net/](http://mbldr.sourceforge.net/ "External link") besides of course grub4dos: [http://www.boot-land...hp?showforum=66](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showforum=66 "External link") Without more details, size of the hard disk, size and filesystem of partitions, actual program used, etc., etc. it's not possible to point you to the best possible solution. ![:smiling9:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/smiling9.gif) Wonko

> no i did not use the winPE rescue disc (that is only included in the full version
Site offers a BartPE plugin todobackup.cab. You may create a own winPE and integrate this.  

> i used there own rescue disc
This use isolinux as boot loader.  
Download current syslinux package.   
Use syslinux installer syslinux.exe.  
Integrate syslinux to partition boot code.  
Copy files to hard disk, adjust syslinux configuration.  
[http://www.boot-land...hp?showforum=92](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showforum=92 "External link")  

Or copy ISO file to partition and try ISO file mapping  
[http://www.boot-land...hp?showforum=66](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showforum=66 "External link")
